thread.title: Marshawn Lynch ’60-40 not playing’ on Monday night against Lions
thread.title_full: Marshawn Lynch ’60-40 not playing’ on Monday night against Lions

author: Jesse Reed
title: Marshawn Lynch ’60-40 not playing’ on Monday night against Lions
text:
Marshawn Lynch ’60-40 not playing’ on Monday night against Lions Sportsnaut 10 hrs ago Jesse Reed © Otto Greule Jr / Getty Images There is a chance that Marshawn Lynch will sit out in the Seahawks game against the Lions. The Seattle Seahawks might have to play on Monday night without the heart and soul of their offense, as running back Marshawn Lynch is reportedly “60-40 not playing.”
AdChoices This figure comes by way of Pro Football Talk , citing a source.
Should Lynch not be able to take the field for the nationally televised Monday Night Football game on ESPN, then it will likely fall to rookie running back Thomas Rawls out of Central Michigan to carry the load.
He took full advantage of his opportunity in Week 3 when it became clear Lynch’s hamstring injury was hindering him badly. Rawls rushed for 104 yards on 16 carries in relief and looked very much like he belongs in the NFL.
It’s a long season, and Seattle would be wise to let Lynch take a page out of the Buffalo Bills’ playbook by letting the veteran back rest up until he’s 100-percent healthy.
